edu.berkeley.compbio.sequtils.strings
Class RonPSTNode

java.lang.Object
  com.davidsoergel.dsutils.AbstractGenericFactoryAware
      edu.berkeley.compbio.sequtils.strings.RonPSTNode
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.davidsoergel.dsutils.GenericFactoryAware
Direct Known Subclasses:
RonPST
public class RonPSTNode
extends com.davidsoergel.dsutils.AbstractGenericFactoryAware

A node of a Probabilistic Suffix Tree, where each symbol is a byte. Much of this code is very similar to that found in MarkovTreeNode, but I thought it best to separate them to avoid confusion (i.e., because a PST grows to the left whereas a Markov tree grows to the right, and such).

A PST node by itself doesn't represent a spectrum like a MarkovTreeNode does; for that you need the root. So, we don't implement SequenceSpectrum or MutableDistribution here.

Version:
$Id: RonPSTNode.java 465 2009-06-29 18:12:56Z soergel $
Author:
David Soergel

setAlphabet

public final void setAlphabet(byte[] alphabet)
Sets the array of valid symbols. The order is important since various other arrays (e.g. upstreamNodes) are of the same size and use the same indexes.

Parameters:

Returns:

getUpstreamNodes

public RonPSTNode[] getUpstreamNodes()
Returns an array of upstream nodes for each symbol, indexed by the alphabet index. Contains nulls for symbols where no upstream node exists.

public boolean isLeaf()
Tells whether this node is a leaf or not.

Returns:
true if this node has no upstream nodes, and false otherwise

public RonPSTNode addUpstreamNode(byte[] suffix)
                           throws SequenceSpectrumException
Gets the upstream node associated with the given suffix starting from this node, creating it (and nodes along the way) as needed

Parameters:
suffix - the sequence of symbols to follow from this node
Returns:
the node at the end of the chain of transitions

addUpstreamNode

public RonPSTNode addUpstreamNode(byte sigma)
Gets the upstream node associated with the given symbol starting from this node, creating it first if needed.

Parameters:
sigma - the transition to follow from this node
Returns:
the node at the other end of the transition

appendString

public void appendString(Formatter formatter,
                         String indent)
Appends a string representation of this node to the given formatter, indenting as needed based on the hierarchy level.

Parameters:
formatter - a Formatter, mostly as a convenience for rendering doubles with limited precision
indent - a String to use to indent this node and its children. This will get longer as the recursion proceeds towards the leaves of the tree.

getIdBytes

public byte[] getIdBytes()
Gets the id of this node, which is just the suffix associated with this node represented as a byte[].

copyProbsFrom

public void copyProbsFrom(SequenceSpectrum spectrum)
Recursively fills out the tree so that each node has either a complete set of probabilities or none at all, and assigns conditional probabilities according to the given spectrum. That is: if this node has any children, ensures that there is a probability for each symbol in the alphabet. There may or may not be a child node for each symbol, though.

countUpstreamNodes

public int countUpstreamNodes()
Counts the immediately upstream nodes that exist.

public List<RonPSTNode> getAllUpstreamNodes()
Gets a List of all nodes in the subtree starting from this node, including this node.

Returns:
a List of all nodes in the subtree starting from this node, including this node.

getId

public String getId()
Gets the id of this node, which is just the suffix associated with this node represented as a byte[], here converted to String for the sake of the Clusterable interface.

getUpstreamNode

public RonPSTNode getUpstreamNode(byte b)
                           throws SequenceSpectrumException
Get the upstream node for the specified symbol. Returns null if the node does not exist.

Parameters:
b - the symbol specifying the upstream transition to follow
Returns:
the node found by following the requested transition, or null if the node does not exist.
Throws:
SequenceSpectrumException - if the requested symbol is not part of the alphabet

normalize

public void normalize()
               throws com.davidsoergel.stats.DistributionException
Normalize the underlying probability distribution

Throws:
com.davidsoergel.stats.DistributionException

updateLogProbsRecursive

public void updateLogProbsRecursive()
Takes the logs of all the probabilities at this node and caches them; then follows the upstream transitions and repeats recursively.

public void updateLogProbs()
Takes the logs of all the probabilities at this node and caches them.
